title: NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as BoE's Saunders Says Cuts May Be Needed
text:
NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as BoE's Saunders Says Cuts May Be Needed

Forex 4 minutes ago (Sep 27, 2019 03:14AM ET)

© Reuters. Investing.com -- Sterling fell over half a cent against the dollar and by a third of a cent against the euro, after a top Bank of England official warned that the economy may need lower interest rates even if the country manages to leave the European Union with a transitional deal. Michael Saunders will make the comments in a speech in Barnsley, northern England, according to wire reports

Saunders is viewed as one of the most "hawkish" members of the BoE's Monetary Policy Council

GBP/USD at $1.2282 vs $1.2328 before the remarks

GBP/EUR at $1.1255 vs $1.1290 beforehand

UK Gilt yield at 0.48% vs 0.56%

opens up 0.9%

NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as BoE's Saunders Says Cuts May Be Needed
description: NewsBreak: Sterling Falls as BoE's Saunders Says Cuts May Be Needed
